<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 224, 160, 237]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 259]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 225, 919, 240]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[623, 224, 722, 248]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[869, 225, 889, 240]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[51, 262, 80, 280]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 279, 322, 292]]<|/det|> ## FURTHER MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 304, 366, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[827, 305, 905, 319]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 328, 905, 343]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 393, 370]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 391, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 222, 432]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 758, 466]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 350, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 866, 544]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 590]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 620]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 714]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ] . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[270, 868, 727, 885]]<|/det|> This document has 20 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 919, 96]]<|/det|>
1 Find the roots of the equation \(z^{3}=27-27 \mathrm{i}\), giving your answers in the form \(r \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta}\), where \(r>0\) and \(-\pi \leqslant \theta<\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 70, 609, 104]]<|/det|>
2 Let \(I_{n}=\int_{0}^{1}(1-x)^{n} \sinh x \mathrm{~d} x\) ，where \(n\) is a non－negative integer．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 107, 521, 128]]<|/det|>
（a）Show that，for \(n \geqslant 2, \quad I_{n}=-1+n(n-1) I_{n-2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 603, 366, 621]]<|/det|>
（b）Find the exact value of \(I_{2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
3 By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z-\frac{1}{z}\right)^{5}\), where \(z=\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 99, 220, 115]]<|/det|>
to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 142, 642, 170]]<|/det|>
\[
\operatorname{cosec}^{5} \theta=\frac{a}{\sin 5 \theta+b \sin 3 \theta+c \sin \theta}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 193, 483, 210]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
4

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[125, 91, 869, 503]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 517, 918, 551]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y=\frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{x}}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n-1\) rectangles
of unit width. of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 570, 672, 587]]<|/det|>
(a) By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[375, 605, 623, 645]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}<\left(2+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}\right) \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{n}}-2 \mathrm{e} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 616, 919, 634]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 248, 730, 291]]<|/det|>
(b) Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 544, 91]]<|/det|>
5 Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 110, 594, 146]]<|/det|>
\[
6 \frac{\mathrm{~d}^{2} x}{\mathrm{~d} t^{2}}+3 \frac{\mathrm{~d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}+6 x=\mathrm{e}^{-t}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 160, 399, 189]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t=0, x=\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 791, 91]]<|/det|>
6 (a) Starting from the definitions of tanh and sech in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[417, 101, 581, 120]]<|/det|>
\[
1-\tanh ^{2} u=\operatorname{sech}^{2} u .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 513, 443, 549]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d} t}\left(\operatorname{sech}^{-1} t\right)=-\frac{1}{t \sqrt{1-t^{2}}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 236, 91]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[281, 99, 719, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\tanh ^{-1} t \quad \text { and } \quad y=t \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t, \quad \text { for } 0<t<1
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 141, 496, 175]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=-\sqrt{1-t^{2}}+\left(1-t^{2}\right) \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 447, 338, 486]]<|/det|>
(d) Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} y}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
7 Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[399, 110, 601, 147]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}-\frac{x+5}{x^{2}+10 x+61} y=1,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 628, 183]]<|/det|>
given that \(y=0\) when \(x=3\) ．Give your answer in an exact form．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[973, 231, 989, 382]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[973, 426, 989, 577]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 93]]<|/det|>
8 (a) It is given that \(\lambda\) is an eigenvalue of the non-singular square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvector \(\mathbf{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 119, 714, 140]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^{3}\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 400, 316, 417]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 425, 576, 483]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{A}=\left(\begin{array}{rrr}
-1 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 1 & 0 \\
0 & -2 & 5
\end{array}\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 532, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\) are \(-1,1\) and 5 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 688, 97]]<|/det|>
(c) Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}-2 \mathbf{I}=\mathbf{P D P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 570, 918, 588]]<|/det|>
(d) Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \((\mathbf{A}-2 \mathbf{I})^{3}=a \mathbf{A}^{2}+b \mathbf{A}+c \mathbf{I}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
